overview:
## Overview

You create an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearch/Request] object when you want to search for map locations based on a natural language string. For example, if your interface allows the user to type in addresses, place the typed text in this object and pass it to an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearch] object to begin the search process. When specifying your search strings, include a map region to narrow the search results to the specified geographical area.

When creating an MKLocalSearch.Request object yourself, set the [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearch/Request/naturalLanguageQuery] property to an appropriate search string, as in the following example:

If your app uses an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearchCompleter] object to implement autocomplete support for user-supplied search strings, initialize your search request using the search completion that the user selects. In that case, use the [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearch/Request/init(completion:)] method instead of the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/init()] method to initialize your search request object. The completion object automatically provides the value for the [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearch/Request/naturalLanguageQuery] property.

# MKLocalSearch.Request

**Class**

The parameters to use when searching for points of interest on the map.

## Declaration

```swift
class Request
```

## Overview

You create an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearch/Request] object when you want to search for map locations based on a natural language string. For example, if your interface allows the user to type in addresses, place the typed text in this object and pass it to an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearch] object to begin the search process. When specifying your search strings, include a map region to narrow the search results to the specified geographical area.

When creating an MKLocalSearch.Request object yourself, set the [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearch/Request/naturalLanguageQuery] property to an appropriate search string, as in the following example:



If your app uses an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearchCompleter] object to implement autocomplete support for user-supplied search strings, initialize your search request using the search completion that the user selects. In that case, use the [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearch/Request/init(completion:)] method instead of the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/init()] method to initialize your search request object. The completion object automatically provides the value for the [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKLocalSearch/Request/naturalLanguageQuery] property.

## Creating a local search request

- **init()**: Creates a local search request.
- **init(completion:)**: Creates and returns a search request based on the specified search completion data.

## Initializing a natural language search request

- **init(naturalLanguageQuery:)**: Initializes and returns a local search request based on the provided string.
- **init(naturalLanguageQuery:region:)**: Initializes and returns a local search request based on the provided string and region.

## Configuring the search parameters

- **addressFilter**: A filter that lists which address options to include or exclude in search results.
- **naturalLanguageQuery**: A string containing the desired search item.
- **region**: A map region that provides a hint as to where to search.
- **physicalFeature**: A value that indicates that search results include physical features.
- **pointOfInterestFilter**: A filter that lists point-of-interest categories to include or exclude in search results.
- **regionPriority**: A value that indicates the importance of the configured region.
- **resultTypes**: The types of items to include in the search results.
- **MKLocalSearch.Request.ResultType**: Options that indicate types of search results.

## Creating a search request

- **init(request:)**: Creates and returns a search object with the specified parameters.
- **init(request:)**: Creates and returns a search object for fetching points of interest.
- **MKLocalSearch.ResultType**: Options that indicate types of search results.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
